article.headline: Holy Cross 82, Bucknell 69
article.story: WORCHESTER, Mass. -- Devin Brown scored 29 points to lead Holy Cross to an 82-69 win over Bucknell on Saturday. R.J. Evans had with 15 points and Andrew Beinert added 10 for the Crusaders (4-14, 1-2 Patriot League), who snapped a three-game losing streak. Eric Meister finished with eight points and 11 rebounds. The Bison (6-13, 1-2) took a 42-38 lead on Patrick Behan's jumper with 14:24 left in the second half. But Bucknell wouldn't lead again, as Holy Cross went on a 10-0 run, capped by Evans' layup. Brown, who shot 10 of 14 from the floor and 4 of 6 from beyond the 3-point line, pushed the Crusaders' margin to 13 with a layup. Bucknell's Bryson Johnson and Darryl Shazier each scored 16 points. Mike Muscala had 14 points and Behan added 12. Holy Cross shot 80 percent (24-for-30) from the free-throw line to the Bisons' 63 percent (5-for-8). The Crusaders outrebounded Bucknell 35-19.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
